sub_title: Passionate and Highly Motivated Town Planning Professional
summary:
I am currently looking for a full-time job in the field of Town Planning as a planner /consultant/ researcher. I am very much looking forward to applying my knowledge, skills, and enthusiasm to make our city a place where people can live happily, inclusively, and sustainably.

I would appreciate it if you could let me know if you know/ have, or anticipate having any job opportunities in my field of expertise. Please feel free to send me a message or reach me at chingyu50020@gmail.com

- SUMMARY -

Ching-Yu is a passionate and highly motivated young Planning Professional with a strong commitment to creating more livable and sustainable cities. She is skilled in problem-solving, cross-sector collaboration, and stakeholder communication to deliver transformative solutions for a diverse portfolio of complex planning projects. Former colleagues and professors describe her as a result-oriented self-starter and team player with a keen eye for detail and a fearless attitude toward innovation. She has an educational background in both urban planning and design and is familiar with a variety of software and design tools including Microsoft, AutoCAD, ArcGIS, SketchUp, and Adobe packages. Last but not least, She is not afraid of stepping out of her comfort zone and is eager to keep learning, exploring, and improving.

Looking forward to being a booster of your team performance and a source of fun in the working environment!

awards.description:
Award: Bronze Medal Award (among 29 works)

- Developed a vision and guidelines for the future development of the Penghu Islands (Taiwan) which were implemented on the ground by the local government.

publications.name: Physical Environment Analysis of Traditional House by Numerical Computational Methods with Particular Reference of Lin Family Mansion and Garden

authors.headline: Passionate and Highly Motivated Town Planning Professional

company.name: Taiwan Institute of Urban and Regional Research

profile_positions.company: Taiwan Institute of Urban and Regional Research
profile_positions.description:
- Published in the Journal of Architecture, Volume110, p67-84.
- Employed a combination of qualitative and quantitative research methodologies to examine the correlation between spatial configuration, human activities, and thermal comfort within a Taiwanese traditional Mansion and Garden.
- Spearheaded interdisciplinary collaboration in publishing high-quality newsletters, reports, and presentations for both internal and external stakeholders, ensuring accurate and impactful communication of research findings.
- Leveraged various software tools and statistical analysis programmes to proficiently analyse large datasets, resulting in valuable insights and contributions to the interpretation of complex qualitative and quantitative research data.
profile_positions.title: Urban Research Assistant

company.name: Chang Fong Engineering and Consultancy Firm

profile_positions.company: Chang Fong Engineering and Consultancy Firm
profile_positions.description:
- Led the intern team in 3 urban and regional planning projects in New Taipei City (Taiwan):
     • Conducted feasibility analysis for future development and construction in rapidly developing areas
     • Developed strategic urban renewal plans focused on revitalising areas surrounding metro station sites
     • Designed a master plan for the transformation of port areas and the regeneration of brownfield land

- Catalysed project alignment and effective decision-making in a large-scale development initiative by coordinating communication among key stakeholders and fostering their active involvement in the planning process through public hearings.
- Developed and implemented project plans for planning applications within tight timeframes, actively engaging in various stages of the planning process, from early strategy development through feasibility assessments and impact assessments.
profile_positions.title: Town Planner
